title: Strong Fiscal Policy
description: In 2023, Samoa received a CPIA fiscal policy rating of 4.5, indicating a robust fiscal framework compared to other nations.

title: Efficient Revenue Mobilization
description: Samoa's CPIA efficiency of revenue mobilization rating stood at 4.5 in 2023, showcasing effective revenue collection strategies.

title: Quality Public Administration
description: The CPIA quality of public administration rating for Samoa was 4 in 2023, reflecting a competent public administration system.

title: Effective Public Sector Management
description: In 2023, Samoa achieved a CPIA public sector management and institutions cluster average of 4.1, highlighting efficient governance structures.

title: High Unmet Need for Contraception
description: In 2020, 38.9% of married women aged 15-49 in Samoa had an unmet need for contraception, indicating significant gaps in family planning services.

title: Low International Tourism Expenditures
description: Samoa's international tourism expenditures were $1.8 million in 2020, reflecting limited spending by tourists in the country.

title: Minimal Merchandise Imports from Outside Region
description: In 2023, only 0.16% of Samoa's total merchandise imports came from low- and middle-income economies outside its region, indicating limited trade diversification.

title: Moderate Government Subsidies
description: In 2021, subsidies and other transfers accounted for 6.13% of Samoa's expenses, suggesting a moderate level of government support.
